column1: Metro Nativitas  is a station on Line 2 of the Mexico City Metro system.  It is located in the Colonia Nativitas and Colonia Lago neighborhoods of Benito Juárez borough of Mexico City
column2: directly south of the city centre on Calzada de Tlalpan. It is a surface station.

column1: The station logo depicts a trajinera – a type of small punt-style boat
column2: still used today in the canals of Xochimilco. The name Nativitas refers to a lake that formerly existed here
column3: on which the inhabitants farmed on a network of artificial islands known as  chinampas. The name later referred to a small villa built in the outskirts of Mexico City during the first half of the 20th century.  The station opened on 1 August 1970.

column1: East: Calzada de Tlalpan between Justina street and Don Luis street
West: Calzada de Tlalpan and Lago Poniente street
